channel.title: I wonder
channel.description:
If you're deaf from birth, what language do you think in?
When I think in my head, it's in English.. but if you've never had the ability to learn a language, what do you think in? That's so weird, I thought about it before.. and couldn't figure it out.
Discuss.

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

I thought only schizophrenic people think in voices?

As for me-- I think in images, as well as any other normal human being.

Read full topic

you might find this interesting, a blind man, talent for art :: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L3AgO6H0H98 ::

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

They think in no language - just like everyone else. If deaf from birth they often have developmental problems due to language being closely tied to other concepts so tightly. Also they eventually learn sign language, if whoever brings them up isn’t an idiot.

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:26, topic:361523”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=457793.msg3353723#msg3353723 date=1285588965]
Deaf people think in the language they speak in (since they’re not mute). I also wonder, can they hear their thoughts?
[/quote]

my theory is that they can hear it cause u dont use your ears to hear ur thoughts[/quote]
Thoughts are in your mind…

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:27, topic:361523”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=457793.msg3353723#msg3353723 date=1285588965]
Deaf people think in the language they speak in (since they’re not mute).
[/quote]

A prelingual deaf person isn’t mute, but is unable to learn vowels. Asking them to think in their country’s language is the same as asking you to think in Niedersächsisch. You’ve never heard it, so you can’t think in that language.

Besides, a deaf person doesn’t speak. They make retarded noises at best.[/quote]
Then how they think?

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Rixxx:

Deaf people think in the language they speak in (since they’re not mute).

A prelingual deaf person isn’t mute, but is unable to learn vowels. Asking them to think in their country’s language is the same as asking you to think in Niedersächsisch. You’ve never heard it, so you can’t think in that language.

Besides, a deaf person doesn’t speak. They make retarded noises at best.

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:23, topic:361523”]What if you believe in reincarnation, so, when you die, instead of RIP on your gravestone it says BRB

Has anyone really been far even as decided to use even go want to do look more like?

You’ve got to be kidding me. I’ve been further even more decided to use even go need to do look more as anyone can. Can you really be far even as decided half as much to use go wish for that? My guess is that when one really been far even as decided once to use even go want, it is then that he has really been far even as decided to use even go want to do look more like. It’s just common sense[/quote]

Actually I’m Shinto. Reincarnation supposedly happens.

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

dragonfire455:

What language would you know if you can’t even verbally speak it. Let alone sound it out in your head?

You learn to write it…

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:

[quote=“dragonfire455, post:19, topic:361523”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=457793.msg3351187#msg3351187 date=1285351453]
I assume you just wouldn’t verbalize your thoughts.

If you had no language at all, anyway. If you’re just deaf you’d use whatever language you know…
[/quote]What language would you know if you can’t even verbally speak it. Let alone sound it out in your head?[/quote]

Signing is taught in English.

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

My mom has been deaf from birth and I’m pretty sure she thinks in english but I’ve never bothered to ask her. Oh and lawl made the best post to date.

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Personally I don’t think in any language… I don’t necessarily see an animation of myself doing something, but I imagine what I’m going to do and how to do it, with images, and once I’ve figured that I just do it…

I’m sure if you never learned any language, you would just visualize what you’re going to do

If you were blind though, … You will have never seen anything, so you wouldn’t have anything to visualize. Maybe you would use like, flashes of light to simulate things? Who knows. lol

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

la­wl:

Imagine punching somebody so hard that they turned into a door. Then, you find out that’s where all doors come from, and you were initiated into a murder club that makes doors. The stronger you punch, the better the door. So, there are super strong murders who punch people into Venetian doors and shit.

That was…incredible.

Read full topic

item.title: I wonder

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

you don’t think in language, although you do form certain concepts (such as cardinal numeracy) though language
